fields.name: Traders@MIT Spring Competition
fields.description:
The goal of this competition is to let MIT undergraduates get an idea of what trading is like and to practice basic trading concepts. This is a low pressure event geared towards students with little to no prior trading experience. If you have ever wondered what trading is about or you want try to go for the first place prize, we hope that you come to the Spring Competition!

Participation in the tournament is in teams of two. When you register please put the name and MIT email of your partner. If you don’t have a partner, that’s ok, let us know and we will pair you up with someone else who registered without a partner.

Every participant needs to bring their own laptop with the Rotman Client installed. If you have a mac, we suggest you install a free Windows virtual machine From MIT IS&T to be able to run the client.

Schedule

  • 12:30 - 1:30 PM Lunch Chipotle (for people who pre-register), computer set-up
  • 1:30 – 2:30 PM Social Outcry (30%)
  • 2:30 - 3:30 PM Sales and Trader (35%)
    3:30 - 4:30 PM Price Discovery (35%)
  • 4:30 - 5:00 PM Announce Competition winners!

Overall Prize Winners

  1. First Place Prize 2 x $100 Amazon Gift Cards
  2. Second Place Prize 2 x $50 Amazon Gift Cards
  3. Third Place Prize 2 x $25 Amazon Gift Cards

In addition, winners of each case (price discovery, s&t, social outcry) will each receive a trading book.

Practice Sessions

If you are new to trading and the Rotman software, don’t stress! We will be hosting three introductory sessions to get the Rotman Interactive Trader software on your computer, walk through the basics of using it and give you some hints on strategies for the competition. The times are -

  • Monday, April 30th 7:00-8:30PM Room 3-442
  • Thursday, May 3th 7:00-8:30PM Room 3-442
  • Saturday, May 5th 11:00-12:30 PM Room 32-141

Refer a friend

Students who refer other students to the competition will be given extra news items during the social outcry case.  Indicate who referred you when you sign up.

UPDATE: We have canceled this provision.  As of 10:47pm Friday night, no valid referrals had been entered.  Referring yourself, or having your teammate refer you and vice versa, was not considered a valid referral.

Materials for the competition

  • Rotman Client
  • Rotman Tutorial

FAQ

Q: I’m a masters or PhD student at MIT, can I still participate?

A: First priority is for MIT undergraduates, however we don’t expect to fill the competition room with just MIT undergraduates. Feel free to register, and we will let you know beforehand if there will be enough spots.

Q: Is the same as the Traders@MIT Intercollegiate Fall Competition?

A: No, this is a low pressure, educational event aimed at people with little prior experience. We see it as a way to prepare for the Fall Competition - learn to trade at the Spring Competition, then impress company sponsors at the Fall Competition!

fields.name: Using Poker and Game Theory to Trade in the Derivative Markets
fields.description:
Jeff Yass, Founder and CEO of SIG (Susquehanna International Group), will explain how the firm was founded on the principles of game theory—particularly the decision strategies used in poker. He will discuss how poker and other strategy games are still used to train traders and technologists to make decisions in today’s fast-paced and competitive financial markets.
Additional information will be available regarding full-time and internship opportunities in trading and technology.

Food and beverages will be provided.

fields.name: Introduction to Event Driven Trading and Merger Arbitrage
fields.description: Join Jefferies’ Event Driven Strategist, Ted Chen (MIT Sloan ’06), for a discussion on event-driven investing and merger arbitrage. Learn about how event-driven investing exploits mispricings between stocks, and see whether it might be for you. The discussion will be followed by a networking session with several representatives from the Equities Trading division. Jefferies is currently accepting resumes for the 2012 Summer Internship program – feel free to bring a copy to the event.

fields.name: Financial Transaction Tax
fields.description: Join us to learn more about the financial transaction tax with Optiver, a worldwide market maker and derivatives trading firm. The presentation will also focus on Optiver's training program, and will be followed by a trader testing session for students interested in interviewing with Optiver.

fields.name: Working at a Trading Startup
fields.description: Eladian Partners is an extremely successful high-frequency trading startup that has just started recruiting at MIT. Trading startups offer unparalleled opportunities for new hires, and allow for enormous flexibility in terms of work habits and projects. Get the inside scoop on how trading startups work, and what the high frequency trading industry has to offer new startups.

fields.name: Hit The Trading Floor Running: J.P Morgan Floor Trading Game
fields.description:
Ever wondered what the buzz of the trading floor is really like? Looking for a summer internship in trading at J.P. Morgan? Come play J.P. Morgan’s paper trading game! Get a feel for thinking on your feet, calculating probabilities quickly, and immediately taking advantage of opportunities. We’ll teach you the basics, and then it’s over to you. The money may not be real, but the excitement certainly is. Be a part of it.

This event is targeted toward freshmen, sophomores and juniors interested in interning at J.P. Morgan. However, all students are welcome.

fields.attending_employers: World Wide Financial Recruiting Services, LLC
fields.name: Getting Jobs in Algorithmic Trading
fields.description:
Join Traders@MIT and Brennan Hughes and Rob Khoury, founders of World Wide Financial Recruiting Services, LLC in a candid discussion about getting a job in algorithmic trading. Find out the most recent advancements in technology that affect algorithmic trading, and learn how to prepare for success in the industry. Brennan and Rob will talk about the skills you need and what companies look for.

Brennan and Rob will also be hosting a free resume review from 1-5 PM on 10/17 in 4-251. Please choose a timeslot on this Doodle form: http://www.doodle.com/uas664mxsz8m2vm7. Then, please email Brennan Hughes (bhughes@wwfirs.com) with your resume.

Dinner will be provided.

All are welcome, from freshmen to seniors. No trading experience is necessary!

fields.name: Options Greeks
fields.description:
Join Traders@MIT and Belvedere Trading, a Chicago-based proprietary trading firm, to learn about options Greeks, how to manage your positions andmake money.

Founded in 2002, Belvedere Trading is a leading proprietary trading firm. They specialize in equity index, fixed income, and commodity derivatives. They trade electronically from their headquarters in downtown Chicago, and utilize their own proprietary technology, trading models/strategies, and risk management capabilities.

Refreshments will be provided.

Networking with representatives and students to follow.

fields.name: Mock Trading Session
fields.description:
SIG, a world-leading, technology-empowered financial trading firm, is coming to campus to run a mock trading session with Traders@MIT.  All MIT students are welcome to attend.  Representatives will include Pat McCauley, COO of Trading Businesses, and Jarrod Boland, 2008 MIT alum and options trader. The traders will open the session with a brief overview of how SIG uses game theory and decision science to allocate SIG’s capital in today’s options markets.  Students will then have the opportunity to practice trading with each other in a simulated open outcry setting.

Dinner will be provided.

fields.name: Tower Research Capital Tech Talk
fields.description:
Join us for discussion with a portfolio manager at Tower Research Capital, a leading proprietary trading firm in New York City.  Trading groups at Tower conduct advanced quantitative modeling and develop high-performance software to implement their strategies, and the firm as a whole has invested in some of the fastest trading systems in the world.

If your idea of trading involves winning races, if you’re interested in pushing the limits of efficiency in the world’s most competitive markets, join us Monday evening to learn more.

fields.name: Introduction to Trading
fields.description:
Come join the current Traders@MIT Executive Board for a one-hour crash course about the financial markets. Learn about basic trading terminology, asset classes, market players, and trading strategies. Find out more about what the Traders@MIT board is all about.

Freshmen and sophomores – if you are interested in joining the Traders@MIT executive board, we highly encourage you to attend!

fields.name: Interviews Beyond Brainteasers
fields.description: Now is one of the best times for students, especially freshman and sophomores, to identify and target top hedge fund internship opportunities. On Thursday, April 28, 2011, at 7:30 PM, traders and recruiting managers from Weiss Asset Management will speak about how you can be successful in the recruiting process and the opportunities available at their firm through a two-part speaker and presentation event.

fields.name: Global Quant Trading
fields.description:
Dinner will be provided
Desserts and networking with representatives and students to follow.

Two MIT alums will discuss current events and emerging opportunities in quantitative trading, and will also provide a sneak peek at the upcoming Allston Trading Competition.

fields.name: 2010 Fall Trading Competition
fields.description:
Join us for our fall intercollegiate trading competition!  One of our largest events of the year, the competition encompasses five different 45-minute electronic and open-outcry trading events, as well as a pre-competition social mixer, complimentary meals, and sponsor events throughout the day.

Teams of two students each (up to five teams per school) compete for recognition and prizes, including registration in the Rotman International Trading Competition in Toronto for the top two teams.  Schools competing last year included MIT, Harvard, Princeton, Penn, Columbia, Dartmouth, NYU, and Wellesley.

Representatives from our sponsors, including many prominent investment banks and proprietary trading firms, will be in attendance to discuss their companies and trading-related issues.  Sponsors will also present their own, additional prizes to the top teams.

fields.name: 2010 Pre-Competition Social Mixer
fields.description: Appetizers and non-alcoholic beverages will be provided.

fields.name: Decision Science & Poker
fields.description: Find out how Susquehanna International Group, LLP uses poker playing to model risk decisions that their traders make in the financial markets. The examples draw on cognitive biases, behavorial economics and game theory analyses. Learn about types of decisions and errors we all make every day, and how to take advantage of them in games such as poker. This is the last part in a great series about Decision Science – don’t miss it! Prior attendance is not required.

fields.name: Exploring Algorithmic Trading Strategies
fields.description:
Join traders from IMC Chicago in a frank discussion about algorithmic trading strategies – learn about how traders research and discover automated trading strategies, and identify skills needed to be a successful algorithmic trader. After imparting some background in algorithmic trading, IMC traders will share an outdated algorithmic trading strategy to show participants how and why the strategy worked. This will be an invaluable one-time opportunity to get into the mind of an algorithmic trader – there will be a Q&A session at the end.

Please feel free to bring your resume for internship and full-time opportunities in trading.
